multiple-choice.question: Let $n \geq 7$ and $k \geq 1$ be integers, let $A$ be the set of all bitstrings of length $n$ that contain exactly seven 0s, and let $B$ be the set of all bitstrings of length $k$ that contain at least one 1. Assume there exists a one-to-one function $f : A \rightarrow B$. Which of the following is true?
